I have eaten at El Atril three times over the past month (two lunches and one dinner).  It was wonderful each time.  For lunch, I sat outside and had the menu of the day.  The last visit I had a mussels appetizer.  The broth was so good I soaked all my bread in it.  The main course was bonita with vegetables.  Excellent.  The little square where they serve outdoors is pleasant and I was entertained by two different street performances, one a dance and the other music.  At dinner, we sat inside and sampled a number of tapas.  There is a very good variety in the menu and the service was attentive.
